message.content:
cs.NA, cs.MS, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SE 

This paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper presents a user-friendly sparse matrix class with a suite of essential sparse linear algebra functionality, including linear equation solvers and eigendecompositions. 
- cs.MS (Mathematical Software): The paper presents a software implementation of a sparse matrix class with a high-level application programming interface deliberately similar to the widely used MATLAB language. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper presents a hybrid storage framework that automatically and seamlessly switches between three underlying storage formats depending on which format is best suited and/or available for specific operations. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper presents a template-based meta-programming approach to automatically detect and optimize execution of common expression patterns, which is a common technique used in machine learning algorithms. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper presents a user-friendly sparse matrix class that is designed to facilitate relatively quick conversion of research code into production environments, which is a common challenge in software engineering.
